events.title: Formation of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR)
events.description: The USSR was officially established, uniting Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, and the Transcaucasian Federation into a single federal state under communist rule.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of a new federal socialist state that shaped global politics throughout the 20th century.

events.title: First execution by lethal gas in Nevada
events.description: Gee Jon became the first person in the United States executed by lethal gas in Nevada's state prison.
events.significance: Introduced a new method of execution in the US, highlighting changes in capital punishment practices.

events.title: Pakistan executes General Yahya Khan resigns
events.description: General Yahya Khan, former President of Pakistan, steps down after a military defeat in East Pakistan, leading to the independence of Bangladesh.
events.significance: Triggered the end of West Pakistan's control over East Pakistan and led to the creation of Bangladesh.

events.title: Saddam Hussein's execution
events.description: Saddam Hussein, former Iraqi president, was executed by hanging after being convicted for crimes against humanity.
